title: JS SDK: estimateL1Gas doesn't return correct value
body:
<!--
Need help?
Refer to our contributing guidelines for additional information about making a good issue:
https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Describe the bug**
The method estimateL1Gas doesn't give the exact L1 gas used of the transaction 

**To Reproduce**

```
 const HASH = '0xd9fe2820aba65a22ee959f4c203ea34ffb3dedfeac39889783b77bf63a204a6f'

    const l2RpcProvider = optimismSDK.asL2Provider(
        new ethers.providers.JsonRpcProvider('<RPC_URL>')
    )
    let transaction = await l2RpcProvider.getTransaction(HASH)
    let receipt = await l2RpcProvider.getTransactionReceipt(HASH)
    let l1GasUsed = await optimismSDK.estimateL1Gas(l2RpcProvider, transaction)
    console.log('COMPUTED',l1GasUsed.toString())
    console.log('REAL', receipt.l1GasUsed.toString())
```

this output : 
```
COMPUTED 9108
REAL 9092
```


**Expected behavior**
optimismSDK.estimateL1Gas() should return the same as the receipt


Why is there a difference? I'm getting crazy over this
